content: April 1st, 2009 House Republicans roll out alternative budget Posted: 11:53 AM ET WASHINGTON (CNN) — House Republican leaders unveiled their alternative to the proposed Democratic budget Wednesday, calling for $4.8 trillion less in overall spending over the next decade — in part through a five-year freeze in most non-defense discretionary spending. The GOP budget would repeal the entire $787 billion economic stimulus package except for an extension of unemployment insurance benefits. It also would roll back a recently passed 8 percent spending boost in the budget for the remainder of the current fiscal year. Overall, it calls for $3.6 trillion less in borrowing over the next 10 years. “The president’s budget exploits the current economic crisis to justify trillions in new spending, taxes, and debt,” Wisconsin Rep. Paul Ryan, the ranking Republican on the House Budget Committee, said in a written statement. Democrats were quick to criticize the GOP proposal as little more than a way to help the wealthiest Americans at the expense of the rest of the country. This has to be an April Fools joke, right?

Yep, just as much as you don't... I applaud the Democrats and Republicans who are standing up against these scams. And I applaud the Democrats and Republicans who are standing for these laws to help wean us off of foreign oil and help us stop damaging the planet, make more jobs and help us get out of where the old republican congress put us. I don't even know where to begin. Make more jobs....do you mean create more jobs? Maybe you should re read your post to yourself. You would see it makes no sense. Then, maybe you can do some research. If you did research, you would know that over 80% of Democrats have been opposed to further drilling and exploration, while over 90% of Republicans have been in favor. So tell me how they are going to wean us off foreign oil, and create more jobs all while standing in the way of progress. We shouldn't have to beg OPEC for anything. Campaign about further drilling and exploration to get votes, but do the opposite. Yup, just words, just inaction, and just more broken promises. I will say this again. The free market has done more for the environment than the IPCC, Al Gore, the UN, the alarmists and so on. Proven fact. Cap and trade, a bogus new market that makes oil futures look like child's play, will do nothing to better the environment. Nor will carbon taxes and the other scams they are trying to come up with. Seems you need the government to do your research, and tell you what is good for you. I guess you rely on the alarmists, Al Gore and the IPCC to better the environment, instead of the free market. The free market has concrete results, unlike that of your friends. It's amazing that people in this country oppose further drilling and exploration here. All while relying on other countries, who have been experiencing substantial growth in revenues and Real GDP, as well as job creation. The US is greedy, and doesn't deserve to create more jobs, and more wealth here. Let overseas keep their wealth, jobs and prosperity. Not for the US though . Keep dreaming about the 95% tax cuts. They will be heavily offset by cap and trade, and carbon taxes. Maybe you can break free of the bubble and step into reality. There are members on both sides to share the blame. I have already posted my criticism about the Bush admin, as well as others. Something you seem to be unable to do with your own party.

content: NYGOP 4/3/09 The race to decide the next representative for the 20th Congressional District proved to be a nail-biter but the numbers look good for Republicans. As the machines are being re-canvassed, Republican candidate Jim Tedisco has thus far picked up 77 votes since the March 31st Special Election and is now leading opponent Scott Murphy by 12 votes. With over 700 more Republican absentee ballots than Democrats, we will take this seat back from the Democrats who won this seat just four short months ago by more than 70,000 votes. As a result of New York Republican State Committee Chairman Joe Mondello's petition, all absentee ballots have been impounded to help protect the integrity of this election, ensure that every legitimate vote is counted and avoid some of the confusion that we have seen in previous elections.
reply: NYGOP 4/3/09 The race to decide the next representative for the 20th Congressional District proved to be a nail-biter but the numbers look good for Republicans. As the machines are being re-canvassed, Republican candidate Jim Tedisco has thus far picked up 77 votes since the March 31st Special Election and is now leading opponent Scott Murphy by 12 votes. With over 700 more Republican absentee ballots than Democrats, we will take this seat back from the Democrats who won this seat just four short months ago by more than 70,000 votes. As a result of New York Republican State Committee Chairman Joe Mondello's petition, all absentee ballots have been impounded to help protect the integrity of this election, ensure that every legitimate vote is counted and avoid some of the confusion that we have seen in previous elections.
